thread.title: Take a tour of Japan’s Fox Village (VIDEO)
thread.title_full: Take a tour of Japan’s Fox Village (VIDEO)

title: Take a tour of Japan’s Fox Village (VIDEO)
text:
Take a tour of Japan’s Fox Village (VIDEO) Monday July 6, 2015 Print Article 
TOKYO, July 6 — If you’re a big fan of foxes, this village in Japan is basically your dream land. 
Located in Miyagi prefecture, the natural park is inhabited by six species of wild foxes, all of which are relatively tame and allow you to get close to feed and photograph them. 
According to Daily Mail , foxes are heralded in Japan, with many believing they have mystical powers, as well as others who believe they bring good luck as they descend from Inari Okami, the Shinto deity of fertility, prosperity and rice. 
Check out this fox haven posted by Japanese-American couple Rachel and Jun. 
There is a town in Japan entirely devoted to breeding, caring for, and honoring foxes. More Stories for You:
